div.p: V93/4429, unit 818, VPRS 3992/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;

div.p:
I have the honor to acknowledge the receipt of your letter of yesterday, containing the intimation, that his Excellency the Governor has been pleased, again to prolong the term of my services as Gov Botanist.
See T. Wilson to M, 16 June 1893 (in this edition as 93-06-16a).
For this renewed concession I beg to convey my best thanks, particularly also to our honorable Chief
The Chief Secretary, James Patterson. and yourself. All in my power will be done to show myself worthy of the favor again conferred on me.
Wilson initialled M's letter on 17 June 1893. See also T. Wilson to M, 29 December 1893 (in this edition as 93-12-29a), and M to T. Wilson, 29 December 1893 (in this edition as 93-12-29b).

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to be,
